benchmark_details.name: Robust and Fine-Grained Detection of AI Generated Texts
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces a new dataset of over 2.4M human-LLM co-authored texts aimed at training models for token classification to detect machine-generated content.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a robust dataset for detecting AI-generated texts across various domains and languages.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: No detector can guarantee 100% accuracy, and models are meant for human-in-the-loop scenarios.

data.source: An extensive collection of human-machine co-authored texts from various popular LLMs.
data.annotation: Automatically generated with human oversight where necessary.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the models' predictions and majority voting.
methodology.interpretation: Higher metrics indicate better performance in detecting AI-generated content.
methodology.baseline_results: F1 score of 0.79 against adversarial inputs.
methodology.validation: Models were validated across unseen domains and generators.
